samples.context: These are heterotrophic and have a cell wall. The cell wall is made of chitin. Most of the fungi are unicellular.
samples.question: What is a distinctive feature of fungi?

samples.context: They feed on decaying organic materials. Such a mode of nutrition is called saprophytic.
samples.question: What type of nutrition do fungi use?

samples.context: Many of them have the capacity to become multicellular at a certain stage in life.
samples.question: Can fungi be unicellular or multicellular?

samples.context: Some fungi live in symbiotic relationships with other organisms, while some are parasites as well.
samples.question: Do fungi only have saprophytic relationships?

samples.context: Examples: yeast, penicillium, aspergillus, mucor, etc.
samples.question: Can you name two examples of fungi?
